item.description:
IMAGE MAKERS DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHER’S BOOT CAMP!

Have you invested in a digital camera and feel you are barely using the capacity of this new technology?

Are you frustrated by the photos you are making and you want more control over your results?

Do you want to become a better digital photographer?

The [url=http://www.testoftimephoto.com/Digital-Photographer%27s-Boot-Camp.html]DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHER’S BOOT CAMP[/url] is a multi session workshop conducted over a period of weeks that is designed to build your photography skills and improve your image making. The workshops will be held on October 26th and November 2nd,9th & 23rd.

The workshop will feature class/lectures with photography assignments and critique of your results.
Each session will cover a topic of photographic technique and an assignment based on that information. Each photographer will shoot the assigned topic and submit images (via email) prior to
the next class. The submitted photographs will get an individual critique and suggestions for improvement. The following class will begin with a group review of those shots followed by a topic and new assignment.

In the period between classes I will be setting up appointments (10 t0 15 minutes /once a week) with each student for phone conversations. This one-on-one call will be a continuation of the photo critique and a chance to answer your questions. My objective is to provide guidance and encouragement that will improve your photography.

The DIGITAL PHOTOGRAPHER’S BOOT CAMP will require a certain amount of effort and time from those who choose to participate. Like any endeavor in life the more you invest the greater the return. Consider this a chance to learn new photography skills and receive. In this class you will learn, apply the info in your shooting and then get personalized feedback on your results.

SUBJECTS COVERED will include the following (plus many other):

The “MECHANICS “of your digital Camera
Establishing your digital WORKFLOW
Observing and capturing light -taking control of your exposure
Creative Expression- your point of view
Displaying and sharing your images.

What you need for this class:

Digital camera (point and shoot or Dslr)
Camera Owners manual
Email account
Computer
Basis photo editing software*
Desire to learn and improve your digital photography


*I can recommend some low cost, relatively easy platforms for photographer’s who are unfamiliar with these softwares. I will be featuring Adobe Lightroom in the classes and would recommend this as very useful tool for ant digital photographer. You can download a 30 day trial version at the start of the class at no cost if you want to test drive the software.

The workshop includes:

Four 2.5 hour class sessions (10/26, 11/2, 11/9, 11/23)
Weekly critique of submitted photos
Weekly phone consultation

The Fee for this class is $225 and payment is required at the time of registration. The fee includes the class sessions, photo critiques and phone consultation sessions. Class size is limited so sign-up now
